title: EnCon officer shot in hunting accident
content:
GALLATIN – An off-duty state environmental conservation police officer was shot in the leg Tuesday evening when a hunter mistook him for a deer, a source close to the investigation told Mid-Hudson News.
The 36-year-old officer was rushed to MidHudson Regional Medical Center in Poughkeepsie for treatment of the wound caused by a 30-30 rifle shell, the source said.
State Police are investigating the incident which occurred behind US Lumber on Route 7 in Gallatin.
